original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka‘s shares gain in mid day trade on Monday, Colombo Stock Exchange data showed.
The main All Share Price Index was up 0.24 percent or 22.68 points to 9,362.11, the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.45 percent to 12.12 points to 2,685.73.
Top gainers during mid day trade were John Keells Holdings, Richard Pieris and Company and Hayleys.
The banking sector was seeing crossings on banking indexes pushing the index up due to anticipations over a favorable debt restructuring plan, an analyst said.

Massive crossings were seen in Sampath Bank, with 7.7 million shares being traded and contributing 434 million to the revenue, while Hatton National Bank traded 1.5 million shares contributing 207 million rupees to revenue, an analyst said. (Colombo/June26/2023)
